hanzi-su-wiki:
従

Значения

Следовать; быть в сопровождении; следовательно; подчинённый

Мнемоника

Искажено. Точки справа — люди, идущие стопам 止 старшего. Идти 彳 гуськом.

Варианты

從, 从
purpleculture_pinyin:
cóng
old variant of 从
старый вариант from
rtega_mnemonic:
從從RS
从从		従from, by, accompany, undertake, manage, attend to
  • RS. the one that follows 从 (by foot 彳) on the road 龰
  • ⓢ person 人 following another person 人
heisig_constituent: accompany, Nelson, column, going, line, horns, mend
Keyword_KANJIDIC: accompany, obey, submit to, comply, follow, secondary, incidental, subordinate
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: сопровождать, подчиняться, подчиняться, соблюдать, следовать, вторичные, случайные, подчиненный
koohiiStory1: The line of viking soldiers is always accompanied by a horn mending specialist.
koohiiStory2: I´m going to accompany the horny girl to her room so I can "mend" her.
kunYomi: したが.う、したが.える、より
jp_example_words:
従業員(じゅうぎょういん): employee, worker
従事(じゅうじ): engaging, pursuing, following
従来(じゅうらい): up to now, so far, traditional
従兄弟(いとこ): male cousin
従姉妹(いとこ): female cousin
従う(したがう): abide (by the rules), obey, follow, accompany
jp_readingExamples: 従事 (じゅうじ), 従順 (じゅうじゅん), 服従 (ふくじゅう), 従容 (しょうよう), 従う (したが.う), 従える (したが.える)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you see someone loitering around with horns on their head you'd be correct to obey and accompany them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: First of all, this could be really fun. Second of all, if this person is a demon or something, you should really just obey them or they could curse you. What's the worst that could happen?!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you obey the horned man you'll end up with a ton of jewels (じゅう)!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You stole those jewels together and now you're an accomplice for accompanying him! You better hide those jewels!!
Ru_Meaning: accompany, obey, submit to, comply, follow, secondary, incidental, subordinate
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the eight (丷) rolls of cloth (疋) take a step (彳) to obey

従字的基本解释

従
cóng
古同“從（从）”。

従字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cóng］
同“從1”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“從”，《取经诗话》、《岭南逸事》作“従”。按，亦为“從”的日本用简体汉字。
[②]［zòng］
同“從2”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“從”，《取经诗话》、《岭南逸事》作“従”。按，亦为“從”的日本用简体汉字。
[③]［cōng］
同“從3”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“從”，《取经诗话》、《岭南逸事》作“従”。按，亦为“從”的日本用简体汉字。
[④]［zǒng］
同“從4”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“從”，《取经诗话》、《岭南逸事》作“従”。按，亦为“從”的日本用简体汉字。
[⑤]［zōng］
同“從5”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“從”，《取经诗话》、《岭南逸事》作“従”。按，亦为“從”的日本用简体汉字。
[⑥]［sǒng］
同“從6”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“從”，《取经诗话》、《岭南逸事》作“従”。按，亦为“從”的日本用简体汉字。

Name meaning

cóng
яп. вм. 从
Radicals: 彳, 正  (loiter, correct, horns)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you see someone loitering around with horns on their head you'd be correct to obey and accompany them.
First of all, this could be really fun. Second of all, if this person is a demon or something, you should really just obey them or they could curse you. What's the worst that could happen?!
Reading Mnemonic
If you obey the horned man you'll end up with a ton of jewels (じゅう)!
You stole those jewels together and now you're an accomplice for accompanying him! You better hide those jewels!!

并, 彳 (шаг), 疋 (животные)
